comet.controller.conversational_agent package¶

Submodules¶

comet.controller.conversational_agent.conversational_agent module¶

agent is the parent abstract class of all Conversational Agents. It defines the interface that the controller will use.

class comet.controller.conversational_agent.conversational_agent.ConversationalAgent[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract class defining what it means to be a Conversational Agent

comet.controller.conversational_agent.conversational_single_agent module¶

class comet.controller.conversational_agent.conversational_single_agent.ConversationalSingleAgent(configuration, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: comet.controller.conversational_agent.conversational_agent.ConversationalAgent

Essentially the dialogue system. Will be able to interact with:

  • Simulated Users via:

    • dialogue Acts

    • Text

  • Human Users via:

    • Text

  • parser

evaluate_sys_response(tracker, sys_response, sys_utterance=None, raw_sys_response=None, is_exploration=None)[source]¶
User simulator update when receive the response from system
  • Update the simulator’s internal state.

    • curr_patience

    • prev_system_acts

    • Push agenda with what we have from system response

  • Environment give a reward for agent

Parameters

  • tracker –

  • sys_response (List[DialogueAct]) –

  • sys_utterance (Optional[Dict]) –

  • raw_sys_response (Optional[List[DialogueAct]]) –

  • is_exploration (Optional[bool]) –

Returns (tuple): a tuple of rew, success, task_success

handle_message(tracker, user_message)[source]¶

Handle message from user. If the user_message is string. Return user_message. If the user_message is payload: /intent{slot:value} -> return DialogueAct

  • user_message (Dict) – The user_message from user
